statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Colorado State 93, San Diego State 88 (OT)
article.story: FORT COLLINS, Colo. (AP) -- Matt Williams experienced a wide range of emotions. The Colorado State senior forward was tired of losing and more relieved when his team ended an eight-game losing streak. "I'm relieved more than anything else," Williams said. "I was tired of being beaten and that made me more aggressive." Williams scored eight of his career-high 26 points in overtime and Jason Smith added 23 points as Colorado State ended an eight-game losing streak with a 93-88 victory over San Diego State Saturday night. Williams was 8-for-8 from the free throw line and accounted for eight of his teams 15 points in the extra period. Sean Morris had 17 points and sent the game into overtime with two free throws with 9.3 seconds left in regulation for Colorado State (10-14, 2-9 Mountain West Conference). "It was an incredible win for our team," Colorado State coach Dale Layer said. "Sometimes you think you are never going to win again." "I can not tell you enough about the character of this team," Layer said. Brandon Heath had 28 points but missed the front end of a bonus opportunity that would have clinched the game for San Diego State with 20 seconds left. Marcus Slaughter had 18 points, but was limited to 24 minutes of playing time with foul trouble for San Diego State (10-13, 4-6). "That hurt to be without Marcus, but I haven't seen anything like this where we played like we did and played so hard for 45 minutes," San Diego State coach Steve Fisher said. "We were in position to win and didn't." In overtime, the Aztecs led 83-82 on Heath's layup, but Colorado State pulled ahead 85-83 on two free throws by Matt Nelson and one by Smith. Two free throws by Heath tied it at 85-85, but Williams converted two free throws and Michael Morris hit his a short jumper to give the Rams the lead for good. "Once in overtime I wanted the ball and got it," Williams said. "But it was Sean Morris who showed something with the game on the line." San Diego State led 77-74 with 1:10 remaining in regulation after Heath's baseline drive and 3-pointer. Nelson's two free throws brought the Rams within 78-76 before Heath's missed free throws set up the tying free throws by Sean Morris. "People might have given up on us when Heath went to the line, but we didn't," Williams said. "We thought we were still OK." With Slaughter scoring 12 points and Heath's 3-pointer, San Diego State built a 30-16 lead to control the game early. But Smith caught fire, scoring eight straight points at one point for Colorado State which tied it at 37-37 on three free throws by Sean Morris with 1:09 left in the first half. Matt Thomas broke the tie with a driving layup and the Aztecs took a 39-37 lead into halftime. "People look at our record and ask why," Williams said. "We've had health issues and this was the first game in a long time that we had everyone back."
